titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Milton Purdy et al., Judgment
CWG4778

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Muhlenburg Circuit Court
The Comth of Kentucky Plff
against
Milton Purdy & others Deft

The defendants John Clark H D Rothrrock, John R Nichols J F Jones. L W Kincheloe, having been duly Summoned & failing to answer It is adjudged by the Court that the Commonwealth recover of said defendants the sum of Four Hundred dollars that being the amount of their forfeited bail bond for the appearance of Milton Purdy in this Court, at the last May term thereof to answer an indictment against him in said Court & that said defendants pay the costs of the action

A Copy Att J. B. Reno clk
M Cir Ct

Comth
vs } Copy of Jugt
Purdy &c
